Activity: Start the day! Grab a coffee and chat with @rn-1 and @rn-3 about weekend plans to get some positive energy going before diving into work.
Log into the EHR system and quickly browse the latest hospital updates and patient statistics. Check for any urgent messages or notifications.

Review the standardized protocols and tools for assessing influenza symptoms within the EHR. Make sure I'm super clear on the latest updates and changes. Send an email to @clinlead-1 to confirm if there are any updates to the protocol. @PEOPLE = @clinlead-1 Topic: Protocol Updates

Begin patient assessments for influenza symptoms. Focus on accurately documenting observations using the EHR's standardized tools. Make it a point to connect with each patient, smile, and make them feel comfortable.
Lunch time! Head to the cafeteria with @rn-1 and @rn-3 and catch up on the latest hospital gossip and plan for happy hour.
Continue patient assessments and EHR data entry. Pay extra attention to detail when inputting demographic information, medical history, and vaccination status. Double-check all entries for accuracy.

Having some challenges with a specific EHR data entry field. Send an email to @helpdesk-1 and @ehrdev-2 to ask about the specific data entry field. @PEOPLE = @helpdesk-1, @ehrdev-2 Topic: EHR Data Entry Challenges
Follow up on patient assessments. Discuss findings with colleagues and physicians to determine next steps. Communicate important findings and make sure patients are well-informed.
Prepare for shift handover, clearly communicating patient status to the oncoming nurses. Documented important information and observations in the EHR.
Review and summarize my tasks for the day. Submit my shift report.
Head home, excited for a relaxing evening.
